column4: I've got two Ubuntu machines on a LAN. What's the easiest way to share files between them?
SAMBA is windows-like/compatible file sharing
you can also use scp from the command line if you have openssh server installed on both pcs
I'm having trouble using the built-in SMB sharing because the files are on a dmask=077 mount so it can't set the desired permissions
so, I'm using SAMBA, configured from the default GUI "Sharing" dialogs. the problem is that it wants to change permissions on the shared files, but my user can't change those permissions
Are you able to connect/see files?
I can connect and see the names of the shares, but can't mount them, presumably because the permissions on the sharing machine are incorrect
did the 'server' set up samba so that your user can access those shares?
it's the default ubuntu 10.10 samba configuration. my user has permission to create shares, and can access the files in question
have you added users to samba?
I am not the admin on that computer, so I am not sure. My user can create shares, and those shares appear on the network to other computers, so I think the answer is yes
do you have admin access the the server?
no
however, the admin has given me (or I always had by default, not sure which) the ability to create shares
in order for you to access files on the server, the server needs to be configured non-default
I am already able to access files on the server, in directories that my user can change permissions on
my problem is remote access to directories my user on the server has access to, but can't change permissions on
even though you can view or modify a file in samba, you have to be in the group or owner of the file in order to modify the permissions
if you create a file, are you able to modify it's permissions?
depends on the mount. if it doesnt have a umask or dmask, yes. if it does, no (not for the masked bits)
I dont usually use samba, sorry I can't help.  bastidraZor's suggestion was an easy way to implement sshfs.  It would only require that you had an ssh account on the server
ok, thanks
